titleStmt.title: The Nurses Song, by Dean Swift

publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l:
1
Hey my kitten a kitten,_ And hey my kitten a deary;

Such a sweet babe as this
Is neither far nor neary.

Here we go up up up,
And here we go down down downy;

Here we go backwards & forwards,
And here we go round round roundy.

2
Chicky, cockow, my lily-cock;_ See, see, sic a downy;

Gallop, a trot trot trot,
And hey for Dublin towny.

This pig went to market;
Squeek, mouse, squeek-mouse, mousy;

Shoe, shoe, shoe, the wild colt;
And here's thy own dol dowsy.

3
Where was a jewel and pretty?_ And where was a sugar and spicy?

Hush a by babe in a cradle,
And we'll go abroad in a tricy.

Did-a papa torment it?
Did-e vex his own baby, did-e?

Hush-a by babe in a bosie;
Take ous own sucky did-e?

4
Good-morrow! a pudding is broke;_ Slaver's a thread of crystal;

Now the sweet posset comes up;
Who said my jewel was piss'd-all?

Come water, my chicken, come, cock;
Leave off, or he'll crawl ye he'll crawl ye.

Come, give me a hand, & I'll beat him;
Who was it vexed my baby.

5
Where was a laugh and a crow?_ And where was a giggling honey?

Goody good child shall be fed,
But naughty child shall get noney.

Get ye gone, raw-head and bloody-bone.
Here is a child that don't fear ye.

Come, pissy, pissy, my jewel;
And ik ik ay, my deary.
